title: 107_hr5653
content: The correction period for certain transactions involving securities and commodities is outlined in Section 1. Amendment to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions related to securities and commodities within a specified period. Transactions involving employer securities or real property between a plan and a plan sponsor are excluded from this provision. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions involving fiduciaries or parties in interest who knowingly participate in transactions that violate section 406(a). The correction period is a 14-day period starting from the date the violation is discovered or should have been discovered. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions violating section 406(a) within a 14-day period. Amendment of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes definitions of 'security' and 'commodity'. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions violating section 406(a) within a 14-day period. Amendment of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes definitions of 'security' and 'commodity'. Additionally, a new paragraph has been added to subsection (f)(7) regarding the correction period for certain transactions related to the acquisition, holding, or disposition of securities or commodities. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions violating section 406(a) within a 14-day period. Amendment of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes definitions of 'security' and 'commodity'. A new paragraph in subsection (f)(7) addresses the correction period for certain transactions related to securities or commodities. Exceptions to prohibited transactions include those involving employer securities or real property. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 allows for correction of transactions violating section 406(a) within a 14-day period. Amendment of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes definitions of 'security' and 'commodity'. A new paragraph in subsection (f)(7) addresses the correction period for certain transactions related to securities or commodities. Exceptions to prohibited transactions include those involving employer securities or real property. In the case of any disqualified person, subsection (d)(16) does not apply if the disqualified person knew the transaction would constitute a prohibited transaction. Abatement of tax is allowed if a transaction is not treated as prohibited under subsection (d)(16). The amendments made by this section apply to any transaction discovered after the enactment of this Act that constitutes a prohibited transaction involving securities or commodities.
